attributes.action: Scrap High Speed 2 (HS2). Put forward Hyperloop for consideration.
attributes.background:
HS2 provides minimal gains over our existing rail infrastructure. The cost/ benefit ratio is unacceptable to the taxpayer at £55 billion.

If the UK is to spend this sort of money on a transport project, we should be making substantial leaps.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be achieved by implementing Hyperloop technology instead.

With recent announcements from other nations investing in Hyperloop technology, there is a very real worry that if we commit to HS2, the UK will be investing in the wrong choice. 

We'll end up with an overpriced, lacklustre rail technology that is obsolete before the project even gets started.

attributes.action: Create a new licencing law for people transporting horses in trailers
attributes.background: Many people have accidents caused by inexperienced drivers traveling with horse box's (trailers) every day, Usually because these people dont have the experience or training to tow such a heavy loads, People trained to drive B+E vehicles (car & trailer) are trained with empty loads not live animals.
attributes.additional_details:
After careful research I have found that for than 25% of road traffic collisions are caused by people towing horse trailers with horses in them. 
83% of the 25% are motorway collisions causeing full shut downs on the M4 28 times this year alone. 
I believe that new licensing laws are needed for these people that wish to transport their horses around. Especially using the motorway to lower the risk of further accidents and also the trauma this must cause the animals.

attributes.action: Make students learn how to manage money and finance in secondary schools
attributes.background: Students need to learn how to manage their bills and buy food on set budgets. This can greatly improve the standards of young people so that they can go into the world and know what to do with their wage and their savings, instead of wasting money.

attributes.action:
Debate WAVE POWER v Fracking & Nuclear -  all 3 are Constant 
Sources of power.
attributes.background:
Other "constants" Fracking and Nuclear are dangerous and dearer, tax
gets lost, profits go overseas, amnesia over decommissioning & waste.

attributes.action: End disability discrimination through Essential Criteria for Driving Licences.
attributes.background: At present, there is no law preventing a role where the primary function is as a driver, or in the Emergency and Armed Services, to be distinct from a role requiring travel, both having an "Essential Criteria" for a "Full UK Driving licence", thus allowing for selective discrimination of disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Roles that require travel such as the following: 
https://roles.mariecurie.org.uk/VacancyInformation.aspx?VId=58439
are discriminating against disabilities whose condition affect their eligibility to drive.
While there are professions, that should be exempt, such as roles where the primary function is driving, or in Emergency and Armed Services roles, we ask parliament for roles outside these selected professions to apply to be able to list a "UK Driving Licence" as an "essential job criteria".

attributes.action: Give Public Sector Contractors on IR35 same rights and benefits as PAYE staff.
attributes.background:
Since no adequate response given to recent petition by Gareth P Rowell about latest IR35 reforms: 

Please answer how its fair to deem Public Sector Contractors (PSC’s) pay exactly the same rate of tax as 'risk averse' permanent staff, when the latter receive many valuable benefits by default?
attributes.additional_details:
Permanent employment benefits include:

28 weeks Statutory Sick Pay, pension, maternity and paternity pay, long-term job security, gap-less employment, free training, courses, employment dismissal rights and finally of course, an average of 6 WEEKS ANNUAL LEAVE plus many other benefits.

http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/smallbusiness/article-3761454/Tax-ruling-contractors-leave-public-sector-work.html

https://www.ipse.co.uk/news/ir35-proposal-how-will-you-get-paid-april-2017

attributes.action: Place NHS in a trust along the lines of BBC.
attributes.background: NHS has gone through too many changes following political dogma depending on which party or minister is in charge.  NHS requires steady management on long term basis so it can concentrate on long term public heath and needs.  It needs to be taken out of the political arena
attributes.additional_details: Billions wasted on restructuring NHS over the years, staff demoralised, too much bureaucracy with millions wasted on duplicated work in trust hospitals and we never know what the real agenda of the government in power has for its long-term future.  Individual trust hospitals do not work and a national strategy managing ALL aspects of health is required.

attributes.action: Dog food packaging should carry a message stating clean up after your dog.
attributes.background: Local authorities spend hundreds of thousands of pounds annually on this issue and we need to get the message out to our government that this is a live issue affecting recreation, environment and health of the population, and there can be no greater reason to set a petition

attributes.action: Allow people without a degree, but with career experience to train as teachers.
attributes.background: Currently, only people with degrees can train to gain a teaching qualification. Given the shortage of teachers in certain subjects, people with significant career experience should be able to train to be teachers without need for a degree.

attributes.action: Reform both Houses of Parliament to 301 elected members in each house.
attributes.background: Many MPs have jobs other than their parliamentary work. They are clearly under-employed and open to the charge of lack of neutrality owing to their vested interests in their outside employment. Rewards for devoted service to the government should be adequate to ensure no need to earn elsewhere.
attributes.additional_details: The plethora of lucrative jobs now held by George Osborne has precipitated me to address this clear iniquity in the way the so called cost cutting of public services to balance our public deficit was carried out by the previous coalition government. Although many of the UK’s vital public services were reduced by up to 25%, MP numbers remained constant throughout; could it be that parliamentary service is not regarded as public service? Government must show true leadership in this regard.

attributes.action: Department of Transport to reconsider the travel ban on electronics on flights.
attributes.background: The UK Department of Transport have advised, rather poorly, an electronics ban on flights from and to the UK. This will have a massive impact to the image and economy of the UK. The ban should be backed by logic and proven in the latest threat model before making it mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: The Department of Transport should define of what constitutes a mobile phone and the acceptable size to ban an electronic device. It should also prove that the same threat has not moved from hand-luggage to holding-luggage and is still fatal. It should also prove that laptops and mobile phones do not have the same technology capabilities, making mobile phones equally a threat. The DoT should also include safe-keeping of content within holding luggage part of airline carriers responsibilities.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to charge under 18's adult prices.
attributes.background: When booking tickets for travel, entertainment etc. It seems that companies, vendors etc. are very happy to class under 18's as adults and charge them accordingly when in the eyes of the law they are classed as children. How can this be allowed or legal?

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for companies to have a mental illness aware course
attributes.background: I think alot of people are unaware of mental illness' because it can not be seen. Most people dont understand the basic facts on mental health issues. Different situations in a work place can effect people suffering with mental illness' . This will offer support.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe everyone should know how it effects people on a daily basis. 1 in 6.8 people experience mental health problems in the workplace.
It is estimated that 1 in 6 people in the past week experienced a common mental health problem. Diagnosed or undiagnosed it is a major issue that needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Reject bill to decriminalise abortion.
attributes.background: On the 24th of March, 2017, a bill decriminalising abortion in England and Wales will receive a second hearing in the House of Commons. We the undersigned believe the House of Commons should reject this bill and that the current law surrounding abortion should continue to be enforced.

attributes.action: Fine cyclists who block roads when a dedicated cycle path is right next to them.
attributes.background:
Living in a city and being a motorist, I'm sick to death of cyclists holding up busy main roads by cycling on the road itself when dedicated cycle paths have often been built specifically for them at tax payer's expense.

It's time cyclists learned to respect the rules of the road as drivers must.

attributes.action: Build a new Parliament building fit for the 21st Century.
attributes.background: Instead of spending a fortune on a decaying building that is build on extremely valuable land. Sell it for redevelopment and construct a purpose built Parliament building fit for the 21st century on cheaper land more central to the country.
attributes.additional_details: Accommodation could be included which would eradicate the need for expensive second homes. At the same time the chamber could be large enough for all 650 MP's. Currently they can't all fit in the house of commons. Offices could be better designed and equipped. If the house of Lords is abolished that chamber could be omitted. The Palace of Westminster could still be used during construction instead of rehousing parliament with all the inherent security and operational difficulties.

attributes.action: Make companies prove equal pay for women
attributes.background: Women can expect to earn significantly less than men over their careers as a result of differences in caring responsibilities, clustering in low skilled and low paid work, the qualifications and skills women acquire, and outright discrimination. The overall gap is 13.9%.
attributes.additional_details: We were inspired to make this petition due to Iceland announcing today the decision to enforce companies of 25 or more staff to prove that they pay all employees the same regardless of gender, ethnicity, sexuality or nationality. If the UK Government is as dedicated to equality as they say they are, then they should force all companies to do the same.

attributes.action: Stop ministers from overuling local councils in rejected planning applications.
attributes.background: A controversial plan for 450 homes on Medway’s green lung will go ahead, after the minister has rubber stamped and ignored local residents and local councillers. This development goes against the very clear wishes of the public.
attributes.additional_details:
Durring the mornings and evenings rush hours the roads around this proposed development are jammed with too many vehicles as it.
 This area of Lordswood simply cannot cope with anymore houses. The local doctors surgerys cannot and will not see the existing patients in a timely manor, The local accident and emergency is the Medway Maritine hospital which is in continual special measures and cant cope. Drainage and water supplies are also strained

attributes.action: Strengthen punishments for hate crimes against LGBT and other people.
attributes.background:
LGBT, religious minorities and other people experience hate crimes on a daily basis.
The current system is broken, crimes are not reported because the fear of the perpetrator being let off easily, this needs to change.

We call on her majesty's government to strengthen punishments for hate crime.
attributes.additional_details:
LGBT, religious minorities and other people experience hate crimes on a daily basis.
The current system is broken, crimes are not reported because the fear of the perpetrator being let off easily, this needs to change.

We call on her majesty's government to strengthen punishments for hate crime, and to put an emphasis on eradicating inequality.

Instagram & Twitter: @St__Campagin
Facebook: Stronger Together

attributes.action: Prevent the return, to Britain, of British citizens that went to fight for Isis.
attributes.background: With the imminent defeat of Isis, particularly in Iraq, it would put the security of the UK at further risk if the people who went to Iraq to fight for Isis to be allowed to return to live in the U.K.

attributes.action: In this time of Austerity, remove subsidised dining/drinking from both houses
attributes.background: We are all in this together. Savings on the public purse must be made. It is time that subsidies on food and drink are withdrawn from both houses of parliament.

attributes.action: To close a gap in the law, disability discrimination - a school place rejected.
attributes.background: The law prevents to make an appeal on disability discrimination case against LA if they fail to secure a place at chosen by parents school. School also cannot be a challenge on this issue. In the result no one is responsible and a disabled child is discriminated when that placement is rejected.
attributes.additional_details: Under Schedule 17 of the Equality Act, 2010 Tribunal Special Educational Needs and Disability only has the power to consider a claim against the responsible body for school and cannot consider a claim against the local authority for the exercise of powers to determine the admission. The decision about child admission is made by local authority only and if the process is not correct parents cannot pursuit claim of disability discrimination against the local authority.

attributes.action: Make posing as someone else via online sites illegal (catfishing)
attributes.background: After personally being 'catfished' and reading about so many others, it's about time it was made illegal. It's completely and utterly disgusting that in this day in age people can pose as someone else online, prey on vulnerable people and leave them feeling violated for their own enjoyment.
attributes.additional_details: In 2014, via an online site, I met 'Darren'. Widowed father of a seriously ill daughter, Georgina. 'Darren' and I spoke for 8 months.In fact, you could say, We knew most things about each other.every time we arranged a meeting, something came up his end. Unfortunately,there isn't enough room for me to explain the whole story on this petition. But I'm sure you get the gist.Darren, his sister and best friend, were all Made up characters by a female who clearly preys on the vulnerability of others.

attributes.action: To hold a referendum on whether or not to we continue to pay Foreign Aid
attributes.background: The government debated, loosely, the merits of foreign aid payments as a fixed percentage of GDP back in mid 2016.  This decision needs to be taken out of the hands of government and put into the hands of the people via a referendum.  Circa £12bn per year is at stake to public services.
attributes.additional_details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/125692

attributes.action: Ensure government treats mental and physical health equally on PIP eligibility.
attributes.background: The Department for Work and Pensions has been told by two court rulings to treat mental and physical health claimants equally by ensuring those with psychological health conditions are eligible for Personal Independence Payment.
attributes.additional_details: Psychological conditions such as anxiety incur additional costs of non NHS funded prescription medication for instance Finasteride which helps individuals attain some personal independence. Government rhetoric has insisted those with mental health conditions are treated equally with physical health conditions. While individuals with physical health conditions receive mobility assistance in the form of Personal Independence Payment, those with mental health conditions do not receive this.

attributes.action: Make 1hr meal breaks compulsory for motorcycle, bicycle, & van couriers.
attributes.background: Motorcycle, van, & bicycle couriers are all often working very long hours with no daily lunch breaks at a set time. Although the work is not technically challenging, it still requires high levels of concentration & physical effort. 1hr lunch breaks will restore concentration & prevent accidents.
attributes.additional_details: Courier &/or food delivery firms are growing in numbers year on year in a big way. There is an ever growing demand for riders &/or drivers. Riders &/or drivers can be paid employees or self employed subcontractors. Many, if not all riders &/or drivers are not currently allowed to have a daily lunch break. Both types of drivers &/or riders deserve the same right to have 1hrs lunch break for their own safety & for the restoration of concentration for the prevention of accidents.

attributes.action: Take English literature off the National curriculum
attributes.background: English literature is not as important as English Language, schools should spend their time teaching students to improve their speaking, grammar and how to articulate themselves.We recently had GCSE mock exams and students who were taught only Language excelled in their results ,where as students
attributes.additional_details: who were being taught Literature and Language failed in both, as more time was spent studying literature.Employers look at English language GCSE qualifications as more important than English literature.Literature should be optional and not compulsory as some students would like to go into the Literature field and it shouldn't be completely discredited, however it should not be as significant to gain a GCSE in English Literature as it is in English Language.

attributes.action: Discontinue religious education after Year 9
attributes.background: Learning about religion is a very important part of living in a fair, democratic society. However, the two hours spent weekly on RE could be of greater use for students studying for their GCSE's.
attributes.additional_details: I am a student, and my peers and I strongly believe that having those extra two hours would really help if used for revision, which will allow us to de-stress, and have time to be the children we're supposed to be.

attributes.action: Cap unfair & ridiculous increases on commercial vehicle insurance.
attributes.background:
Our specialist commercial vehicle insurance has risen from £1800 pa to £3400 pa for no reason, we have not made a claim & now have 1 years no claims discount, Insurance company refuse to provide an answer.
This is kind of increase will result in less vehicles and therefore less employees.
attributes.additional_details:
RSA insured our specialist truck-mounted carpet cleaning machine and van set-up last year with 0 NCD for £1800, this year they are asking for £3400 even though we have earned 1 years NCD and no changes.
I have invested over £75,000 in this machine and vehicle based upon us being able to insure it, I will now have to sell the setup and make 2 staff members unemployed. I also have another setup which is renewable in Sept, if the same happens the business will go under and 8 staff become unemployed

attributes.action: Do not bring 3,000 refugee children into the UK.
attributes.background: These children are currently in a safe country, their needs should be met by that country.  It sends out the wrong message and encourages unscrupulous economic migrants/refugees to send unaccompanied and vulnerable children to Europe so they can follow after them.

attributes.action: To stop the government removing the subsidy for blood test strips.
attributes.background: I would like to ask the government not to remove the subsidy for blood test strips. Diabetics need very frequent blood testing 5+ times a day. The cost of strips is £70.00 the outcome of stopping this is reduced blood glucose testing and more hospital admissions from hyper or hypo glycemic Diabetes.

attributes.action: Stop Government funding the Football Association - divert funds to other sports
attributes.background: The Government provides £30m+ of our tax payers money to the FA. The UK has the wealthiest football league in the world, so this funding needs to stop. Wealthy football clubs should invest in their own sport 100%; they have the means. Many other sports could benefit from re-direction of these funds.
attributes.additional_details: https://fullfact.org/news/does-football-association-get-30-million-year-public-money/

attributes.action: Make fake news reporting by the media a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Fake news stories should never make it to broadcast status or be publicised.
All corporate media outlets whether broadcast news or printed should have to verify, validate and publicise their sources for reports or face criminal charges and heavy financial penalties for disseminating fake news.
attributes.additional_details:
Fake news is a scourge and has been for some considerable time.
It creates distrust of information that is supposed to inform the public.
News media outlets are no longer reliable sources of unbiased news, they are in fact attempting to make news and drive public opinion politically in directions favourable to their owners own views.
The aim of the media is apparently to hold governments and others to account, yet no one is holding the media to account for faking news reports.

attributes.action: Give top Government priority to tackle all sexual abuse, especially child abuse
attributes.background:
Child abuse is a national scandal. 

Rape and sexual abuse of any kind should never be tolerated. Far too little is being done

The Government should give the highest priority to this scandal

This petition pleads for all political parties to unite to stamp down on sexual abuse of all forms
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 20 children are abused (NSPCC)

85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year

Nearly half a million adults are sexually assaulted each year

In 2015/16 police recorded 23,851 adults were raped; 5878 children. 

Only 2,689 convictions (7.5%). In 2011/12 15% were convicted. These figures are a scandal.

1 in 5 women aged 16 - 59 has experienced some form of sexual violence

Only around 15% of those who experience sexual violence choose to report to the police

attributes.action: Change the law on pricing of haircuts/colour. Shouldn't matter what sex you are.
attributes.background: Females have been fighting for equal opportunity for decades. I called a hairdresser today to book an appointment for my partner. I asked for a price and got asked if my partner was male or female, I asked why that was important and I was told because for a female it is more expensive.
attributes.additional_details: Females have been fighting for equal opportunities for centuries. Charging females more for a haircut is no different to females getting paid less for doing the same job as a male. There should be gender neutral pricing laws. The pricing for haircuts/colour should be based on the length of the hair, not the sex of the person having their hair done. I called Kula Kuts in Kent and Toni & guy and both these salons informed me that a female having the same haircut or colour as a male would pay more.

attributes.action: Allow and train our prison officers to use PAVA spray and tasers
attributes.background: Prison officers are faced with violent incidents on a day to day basis. These can include weapons being used by some of the mode violent people in the country. Our officers are expected to be able to deal with these situations by using nothing more than control and restraint techniques. Times change

attributes.action: Stop the Port of Dover using the A20 coast bound lane as a lorry park
attributes.background: For over ten years the port of dover has been stacking lorries on the A20 heading to the port. causing problems to local residents the works are now finished in the port and the main road to it now is the time to stop the practice of stacking lorries in front of our homes.
attributes.additional_details: A new road improvement costing millions has just been completed  with two lanes now in use. Port of Dover Police are stopping lorries on the outskirts of dover for the reason of not blocking the port which also has had a major road improvement with ten lanes to hold the lorries

attributes.action: Put legalizing medical cannabis to a referendum/ballot
attributes.background: If the prime minister is willing to quit the common market because of the will of the people then should medical cannabis for the sick be put to a Referendum/ballot to determine the will of the people? And act on it now!

attributes.action: Re-designate London and the South East's Green Belt as a 'National Park'.
attributes.background: London and the south easts green belt was introduced as a breathing space for Londoners to visit and totals about 580,000 hectares.  Overall the green belt is poorly visited, poorly signposted and visitor provisions, such as disabled access and toilet facilities are  generally non existent.
attributes.additional_details:
The National Parks were introduced to enhance and conserve the natural and cultural heritage of an area and to promote understanding and enjoyment of the special requirements of the park.  There are 10 National Parks in England, which come under the National Parks Authority. These parks are well managed. The parks encourage visitation, improve facilities and work with landowners.

The Green Belt has no such provision, and as such is in reality merely a green blob on the map, which people are aware of, but rarely visit. Access for much of it is limited and not advertised. This is not good enough.  The public should have better access to this countryside and be better encouraged 
to use it. Retitling the green belt would also afford it better protection from developers.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for DVLA to disclose drivers' details to private companies.
attributes.background: DVLA should not be allowed to give out drivers names and addresses to any person or company unless a serious offence has been committed. It should be made an offence to do so.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for dog and cat owners to have a licence
attributes.background:
It should be a legal requirement for a potential pet owner to possess a licence to have that animal.

There should be criminal records and background checks completed 
And a crackdown and some sort of policing to stop people from selling pets online

attributes.action: Make Childcare costs tax deductible for the self employed.
attributes.background: The self employed can't afford to take time off, not just financially. If you stop being available for work your clients find someone else, you fall behind industry trends and your skills get outdated. Child care to the self employed is a must have business expense and should be tax deductible.
attributes.additional_details:
Sole traders are at the forefront of UK business growth, According to the government’s department of business, Energy & Industrial Strategy in 2016 there were 4.2 million non-employing businesses  (which are basically businesses who do not employ anyone but the owner). They account for just under 76% of the overall business population. And 89% of the business population growth since 2000.

The self employed can not survive without child care and the UK can not survive without the self employed.

attributes.action: Make all UK Employee's pay the same rate of National Insurance.
attributes.background:
National Insurance is a tax and is applied to those earning above the upper earnings limit at a lower rate to those below the upper earnings
l
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is about tax fairness nothing else.
If the current standard/base rate was applied to all employee's the extra funds collected could be used to ease NHS funding or as Government see fit .

attributes.action: Legal Immigrants on different visas category  must get ILR
attributes.background: Those immigrants who lived in Great Britain legally for 10 years should get indefinite leave to remain without any question as long as they do not have criminal convictions
attributes.additional_details:
Tier 1 visa category
Tier 2 visa category

attributes.action: Ban Donald Trump from entering UK until he lifts his muslim country travel ban
attributes.background: US President Donald Trump has imposed a ban on people from seven Muslim countries entering the US. This is in contravention of the Geneva convention and is a racist and immoral act. Let him know that the people of the UK do not want him to enter our country until he lifts this ban.

attributes.action: Chemists should provide receipts of prices for all items prescribed by doctors.
attributes.background: and also give information on whether the items can be purchased over the counter. this could save both the customer and the NHS a significant   amount of money and would also show how fortunate we are to have our NHS and only be paying £8.40 per item for such high priced medication.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if people knew how much they cost the NHS each month with un needed repeat prescriptions and half finished courses of medicines, as well as knowing if the drugs available to buy cheaper  over the counter it would greatly change the attitude a lot of people have with regards to our NHS and how they can make a great financial  difference to it, freeing up  money to hire more staff, pay the staff they have a decent wage  and fund further research efforts.

attributes.action: Publish a statement reminding Donald Trump @POTUS of the UN Refugee Convention.
attributes.background: The UN Refugee Convention- Note on Non-refoulement (1977) Clearly states that "The most essential component of refugee status & of asylum is protection against return to a country where a person has reason to fear persecution. This protection has found expression in the principle of non-refoulement"
attributes.additional_details: We ask our elected politicians to send a message to the US President, that any action risking a national of a country listed in his extreme vetting exec order to be returned to the country from which they sought asylum, is a  contravention of the Convention above & more so any action will be met with sanctions, inc. the requirement for any US citizen to fully disclose financial information for the last 5 years if wishing to visit the UK, until such time the said US executive order is rescinded.

attributes.action: Issue a formal condemnation of President Trump
attributes.background: Within his first week, Donald Trump has turned the back of the world's richest country on these fleeing unimaginable horrors; has outright lied to the media of the world; and in an astonishing declaration, happily condoned torture. The UK Government should immediately condemn his presidency.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is a free nation, and should stand up for what is right. Our government is failing us by refusing to object to Donald Trump's abhorrent actions. We must not let division, injustice, and prejudice go unopposed. I believe that we must challenge these actions for the safety and dignity of our country.

attributes.action: Ban all Americans from entering the UK for 90 days too in solidarity with Iran
attributes.background: The United States of America has banned the citizens of Iran, along with those of Iraq, Libya, Syria, Somalia, Sudan, Yemen from entering the country for 90 days. To make a stand against such racial profiling, let's ban them too in solidarity with our brothers in those countries.

attributes.action: I want the Jobcentre on Eastern Avenue in Sheffield to be saved
attributes.background:
The S2 area of Sheffield is full of vulnerable people, the support that is provided from the staff in this building is very positive.
Ive attended other jobcentres in the past but they have no connection with the area or the people in it. Eastern Avenue helps you feel like your not just a statistic
attributes.additional_details: Also why is it that in Sheffield only people from our area are going to be affected? People on benefits are in financial difficulty already and can easily walk to their local jobcentre to attend appointments and now only we are going to have to travel by public transport at additional costs to ourselves. I believed that we all had equal rights in this country and all should be treated the same so why only close the one office. Once again the government in this country treat us like a statistic.
